main_definition: Imagination refers to the ability of the mind to create ideas, images, or concepts that are not present to the senses.

meanings_and_examples.example: Using her imagination, she envisioned a beautiful garden full of blooming flowers.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The power to form mental images or concepts that are not present to the senses
meanings_and_examples.example: His imagination allowed him to see himself as a successful business owner even before he started his own company.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A faculty of forming new ideas and images, giving enjoyment and happiness
meanings_and_examples.example: As children, we often use our imaginations to play games or create stories with our friends.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The ability to invent fictional scenarios for entertainment purposes
meanings_and_examples.example: Movies rely on imagination as filmmakers tell stories that may not be real but are engaging and exciting.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Using the mind to explore, experiment, or create without being limited by reality
meanings_and_examples.example: In literature, authors often use their imagination to transport readers into fantastical worlds full of magic and wonder.
